TASK_SUMMARY: Log each user action with timestamp, resource, session ID, and role at time of action (Ln 07–09)
Store a record of role changes within active user sessions (Ln 09–10)
Implement role-based query interface for audit logs with filters (role, resource, action type) (Ln 12–14)
Support advanced filter options on log queries (e.g., by department and time) (Ln 14)
Maintain clear timeline and consistency of user roles for all actions within a session (Ln 16–17)
Flag and report anomalous or rapid mid-session role switching (Ln 17)
Enable audit log export in CSV, JSON, and PDF with compliance headers and digital signatures (Ln 19–20)
Provide automated weekly/monthly audit summaries by role (Ln 21)
Store logs for deleted users/orphaned actions with anonymized IDs and original role context (Ln 23–24)
Ensure audit logs meet SOC2, GDPR, and HIPAA security and retention requirements (Ln 24–25)

DATA.title: Log each user action with timestamp, resource, session ID, and role at time of action
DATA.summary: Capture every user action in the audit log, including timestamp, specific resource accessed, session ID, and the precise user role at the moment of action. This comprehensive record improves traceability and accountability across all user activities.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Implement audit log enhancements to record every user action with timestamp, resource, session ID, and role at action time.

DATA.title: Store a record of role changes within active user sessions
DATA.summary: Track and persist all user role changes occurring during active sessions to ensure the audit log reflects every context shift. This ensures session logs are historically accurate for compliance and forensic review.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Accurately track role changes within user sessions and ensure logs retain historical role context, even if roles shift mid-session.

DATA.title: Implement role-based query interface for audit logs with filters (role, resource, action type)
DATA.summary: Develop an audit log query interface that enables compliance and admin users to filter logs by user role, resource, and action type. This supports investigation, monitoring, and policy enforcement across complex operations.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Build a query interface for compliance/admin users, supporting advanced filters by role, resource, and action type.

DATA.title: Support advanced filter options on log queries (e.g., by department and time)
DATA.summary: Add enhanced filtering to audit log queries, enabling users to filter data by department, specific time ranges, and other dimensions. This increases precision in compliance reviews and operational audits.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Support advanced filter options on log queries (e.g., by department and time)

DATA.title: Maintain clear timeline and consistency of user roles for all actions within a session
DATA.summary: Ensure the audit trail preserves a consistent and clear timeline of user roles linked to each action during a session. This underpins accurate audits and supports the detection of irregular role-based privilege use.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Maintain session-consistent role information for auditability...

DATA.title: Flag and report anomalous or rapid mid-session role switching
DATA.summary: Detect and notify administrators of unusual or rapid changes in user roles during active sessions. This monitoring helps identify suspicious behavior and strengthens compliance with security policy.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: flag anomalous or rapid role switches...

DATA.title: Enable audit log export in CSV, JSON, and PDF with compliance headers and digital signatures
DATA.summary: Support export of audit logs in CSV, JSON, and PDF formats, including compliance-specific headers and digital signatures for each export. This feature facilitates external audits and regulatory reporting requirements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: allow export of logs in CSV, JSON, and PDF formats, including compliance headers and digital signatures.

DATA.title: Provide automated weekly/monthly audit summaries by role
DATA.summary: Generate scheduled summary reports of audit log data, categorizing actions and events by user role for both weekly and monthly periods. This strengthens oversight and simplifies recurring compliance checks.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Generate automated reports by role, update documentation and training...

DATA.title: Store logs for deleted users/orphaned actions with anonymized IDs and original role context
DATA.summary: Ensure that audit logs for deleted users or orphaned actions are retained with anonymized user IDs while maintaining the original role context. This preserves historical audit integrity and meets regulatory requirements even for edge cases.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: handling edge cases such as deleted/orphaned users...

DATA.title: Ensure audit logs meet SOC2, GDPR, and HIPAA security and retention requirements
DATA.summary: Design audit logging to satisfy SOC2, GDPR, and HIPAA requirements for security, access controls, and data retention policies. The solution must provide demonstrable compliance for all stored and exported log data.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: ensure storage meets SOC2, GDPR, and HIPAA standards...
